data.title: Miss India winners: 2002
data.text:
This is a collection of articles archived for the excellence of their

content. You can update or correct this page, and/ or send

photographs to the Facebook page, Indpaedia.com.

All information used will be duly acknowledged.

Contents

2.1 Related articles on Indpaedia:

Miss India winners: 2002

Miss India Universe - Neha Dhupia

Miss India World - Shruti Sharma

Miss India Earth - Reshmi Ghosh

Miss India Asia-Pacific 2002 - Tina Chatwal

Miss India International 2002 - Gauhar Khan

Neha Dhupia

Miss India 2002: Indian actress and model Neha Dhupia was born on August 27th, 1980, in Cochin, India.Neha Dhupia, a true-blue Virgo, won the Femina Miss India Universe 2002 title and was placed in the top 10 at the Miss Universe 2002 pageant. She is now a critically acclaimed actresses with many hits to her name. She also became a Bollywood actress, but before her Bollywood career, and before she won the Miss India pageant, she appeared in a 2000 Japanese movie, Nattu Odoru! Ninja Densetsu. Neha has gone on to appear in almost thirty Bollywood films.

Neha Dhupia Miss India in 2002 (born on August 27, 1980 in Cochin) Indian model and actress. competed at Miss Universe 2002, placing in the top ten. Dhupia was raised in New Delhi and born to Sikh parents. She went to Army Public School. Neha Dhupia, a true-blue Virgo, won the Femina Miss India Universe 2002 title with her charm and intelligence. She was placed in the top 10 at the Miss Universe 2002 pageant. She is now a critically acclaimed actresses with many hits like, 'Singh is King' to her name.

Neha Dhupia entered Bollywood after winning Femina Miss India title in 2002. She rose to fame with her role in the film 'Julie' where she played the role of a high profile escort.

Miss India Universe - Neha Dhupia, Semi Finalist/ ninth at Miss Universe

Shruti Sharma

Miss India World - Shruti Sharma, semi finalist at Miss World [19th in Top 20]

This green-eyed girl, tried for the contest in 1999 too. "My determination brought me back... fortunately, I succeeded," says the ever-persistent and determined Shruti Sharma. She was a semi-finalist in the Miss World contest, which was decided by the audience by text messaging. Currently, Shruti is an actress in Bollywood. Shruti Sharma is another Miss India who has not kept up in the media buzz. She has one Bollywood movie ‘Tezaab – The Acid Of Love’ and a couple of endorsements to her credit.

Sara Corner – 2001

Born in Kolkata to an Anglo-Indian family, Sara is an economics honors student who wants to start her own travel agency.

Reshmi Ghosh

Miss India Earth - Reshmi Ghosh

This Kolkata girl is now a household name in the television industry and has done a few films as well. Gifted with a golden voice, Reshmi Sharma enthralled the audience at the Femina Miss India Contest 2002.

Tina Chatwal

Miss India Asia-Pacific 2002 - Tina Chatwal, 2nd runner up Miss Asia Pacific, 2002

Delhi girl Tina participated in the Femina Miss India 2002 contest, driven by the desire to translate a dream into reality. Tina validated the faith reposed in her by having bagged the Miss Asia Pacific 2002 second runner-up title. Today, she's established herself as a fashion model, though she's a qualified dental surgeon

Gauhar Khan

Miss India International 2002 - Gauhar Khan

Multi talented Gauhar Khan is a VJ, model, actress and has participated in a reality show. This Femina Miss India International was seen in a Hindi film 'Rocket Singh' along with Ranbir Kapoor. She was also cast in Bollywood's first-ever musical Zangoora: The Gypsy Prince. Gauhar was last seen doing a Helen in Once Upon a Time In Mumbai..

Akshay’s question

When Gauahar Khan responded to a trick question from judge Akshay Kumar during Miss India 2002/: Lifestyle Desk | The Indian Express / July 31, 2023

Gauahar Khan participated in the Femina Miss India Contest in 2002.

She was on the receiving end of a puzzling question by actor Akshay Kumar during the contest. Akshay can be seen asking Gauahar, “There’s a saying ‘Behind every successful man, there is a woman’. Who is behind his failure?”

As the audience cheered at the question, Gauahar maintained her calm and composure before replying, “It is a very true saying that behind every successful man, there is a woman.”

“But, I firmly believe that every single individual is responsible for his own failures because it is one’s choice to go to the right or opt for wrong. Life is a blend of opposites, make the right choice,” she said.
